analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis yongs su bzung ba'i bsam pa ni lhag par mos pa dang / lhag par bsam pa dang 'dod pa dang mos pa zhes bya bar brjod la / mos pa de las gzhan pa'i chos kun tu spyod pas bsgribs pa de la yang rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par yongs su gcod par mdzad pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang 'byung ba de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mos pa sna tshogs
translated: Therefore, the mind that is fully grasped by the seeds of attachment and so on and faith and so on is called aspiration, superior thought, desire, and interest.

original: mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag ste /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi mos pa du ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //

translated: Son of noble family, moreover, the Tathagata knows the many aspirations and various aspirations of other sentient beings and other individuals just as they are.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi mos pa du ma dang mos pa sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi mos pa du ma dang mos pa sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: “Son of noble family, how do tathāgatas know the various and numerous aspirations of other beings and other individuals just as they are?

original: gang zag gang 'dod chags la gnas la zhe sdang la mos pa dang / gang zag gang zhe sdang la gnas la 'dod chags la mos pa dang / gang zag gang gti mug la gnas la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la mos pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang zag gang 'dod chags la gnas la zhe sdang la mos pa dang / gang zag gang zhe sdang la gnas la 'dod chags la mos pa dang / gang zag gang gti mug la gnas la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la mos pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata knows those individuals who are attached to desire but aspire to anger, those individuals who are attached to anger but aspire to desire, and those individuals who are attached to delusion but aspire to desire, anger, and delusion.

original: gang zag gang dge ba la gnas la mi dge ba la mos pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang zag gang dge ba la gnas la mi dge ba la mos pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata also knows those individuals who are attached to virtue but aspire to nonvirtue.

original: gang zag gang dag sbyor ba chung ba bsam pa rgya chen po la mos pa dang / gang dag sbyor ba rgya che la bsam pa chung ngu la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //🔽@336b mos pa gang gis sbyor ba chung la khyad par la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sbyor ba khyad par du 'phags la chung ngu la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges la log pa nyid du nges pa'i khams la 'jog par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang zag gang dag sbyor ba chung ba bsam pa rgya chen po la mos pa dang / gang dag sbyor ba rgya che la bsam pa chung ngu la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so // @336b mos pa gang gis sbyor ba chung la khyad par la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sbyor ba khyad par du 'phags la chung ngu la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges la log pa nyid du nges pa'i khams la 'jog par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The Tathagata knows the persons who have a small practice but are devoted to the vast thought, and those who have a vast practice but are devoted to the small thought.🔽He knows the devotion by which one will have a small practice but will abide in the special qualities, and by which one will have a special practice but abide in the small. original: log pa nyid du nges la yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i khams la 'jog par 'gyur ba dang / ma nges la yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i khams la 'jog par 'gyur ba dang / mos pa gang gis 'dod pa'i khams las shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges la yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i khams la 'jog par 'gyur ba dang / ma nges la yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i khams la 'jog par 'gyur ba dang / mos pa gang gis 'dod pa'i khams las shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: He knows the placement of the element that is destined for the ultimate, and the placement of the element that is not destined for the ultimate. He knows the placement of the element that is not destined for the ultimate, and the placement of the element that is destined for the ultimate. He knows the placement of the element that is not destined for the ultimate, and the placement of the element that is destined for the ultimate. He knows the devotion by which one will transcend the desire realm,

original: gang gis gzugs kyi khams dang / gang gis gzugs med pa'i khams dang / gang gis khams gsum pa las shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs kyi khams dang / gang gis gzugs med pa'i khams dang / gang gis khams gsum pa las shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows by what means one transcends the form realm, by what means one transcends the formless realm, and by what means one transcends the three realms.

original: shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston te /
analyzed: shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston te /
translated: Having known, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las gsum pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las gsum pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the third Tathagata activity of the Tathagata.

original: da ni khams sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni khams sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the power of knowledge of the varieties of elements, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas khams kyis rnam par dbye la mkhas rnams kyis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khams kyis rnam par dbye la mkhas rnams kyis //
translated: The Buddhas, skilled in the classification of elements,

original: mig sogs dag gi rang bzhin gang de khams su gsungs //
analyzed: mig sogs dag gi rang bzhin gang de khams su gsungs //
translated: Have taught the nature of eye, etc. as elements.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mkhyen pa mtha' yas shing //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mkhyen pa mtha' yas shing //
translated: The knowledge of the perfect Buddhas is infinite,

original: rnam kun khams kyi khyad par la 'jug stobs su 'dod //
analyzed: rnam kun khams kyi khyad par la 'jug stobs su 'dod //
translated: And the power of knowledge of the varieties of elements is accepted.

original: rang bzhin dang ngo bo dang stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ngo bo dang stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go //
translated: Nature, essence, and emptiness are synonyms.

original: sangs rgyas khams mtha' dag gi rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa rnams kyi mkhyen pa gang zhig mig la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gang nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rab tu dbye ba du mar gyur pa de la thogs pa mi
analyzed: sangs rgyas khams mtha' dag gi rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa rnams kyi mkhyen pa gang zhig mig la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gang nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rab tu dbye ba du mar gyur pa de la thogs pa mi
translated: The buddhas’ knowledge of the different categories of all the elements is unimpeded with regard to the different categories of the nature of the elements of the eyes and so on, which have the characteristics of inner emptiness and so forth.

original: mnga' ba de ni khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: mnga' ba de ni khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: This is defined as the power to know the different dhātus.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams rab tu shes so ;
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams rab tu shes so ;
translated: “Son of noble family, moreover, the tathāgatas know the eye element, the form element, and the eye consciousness element.

original: / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: They know inner emptiness, outer emptiness, and inner and outer emptiness.

original: de bzhin du khams bco brgyad char yang stong pa nyid gsum gsum dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams bco brgyad char yang stong pa nyid gsum gsum dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, all eighteen elements should be combined with the three kinds of emptiness.

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: They also know the elements of earth and so forth.

original: ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How do they know them?

original: nam mkha'i khams ji lta ba @337a * //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ji lta ba @337a * //
translated: Just as the realm of space is,

original: de bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: so is the knowledge of the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag yongs su brtags pa las yang dag par byung bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag yongs su brtags pa las yang dag par byung bar rab tu shes so //
translated: In the same way, they know that the realms of desire, form, and formlessness arise from conceptualization.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams ni mngon par 'du bya ba'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams ni mngon par 'du bya ba'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: The conditioned realm is characterized by formation.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: The unconditioned realm is characterized by the absence of formation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams ni glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams ni glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: The defiled realm is characterized by adventitious afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba'i khams ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i khams ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: The purified realm is characterized by natural luminosity.

original: 'khor ba'i khams ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i khams ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: The realm of saṃsāra is characterized by incorrect ignorance.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni tshul bzhin rig pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni tshul bzhin rig pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: The realm of nirvāṇa is characterized by correct understanding.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten gnas pa'i khams gang yin pa dang // rab tu gnas pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / rjes su khrid pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / thogs pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / bsam pa'i khams gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten gnas pa'i khams gang yin pa dang // rab tu gnas pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / rjes su khrid pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / thogs pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / bsam pa'i khams gang yin pa dang /
translated: Thus, there are the element of the world's location, the element of the world's stability, the element of the world's guidance, the element of the world's obstruction, and the element of the world's thought.

original: brten pa'i khams gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: brten pa'i khams gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata knows just as it is the element that is the basis of the world, the element that is the basis of complete understanding, the element that is the basis of guidance, the element that is the basis of obstruction, the element that is the basis of thought,🔽and the element that is the basis of reliance.

original: shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston te /
analyzed: shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston te /
translated: Having known them thus, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bzhi pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bzhi pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the fourth Tathāgata activity of the Tathāgata.”

original: da ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the power of knowing superior and non-superior faculties, it is said:

original: kun tu rtog sogs ches rno nyid ni mchog bzhed la //
analyzed: kun tu rtog sogs ches rno nyid ni mchog bzhed la //
translated: Superiority in complete understanding, etc. is accepted as supreme,

original: 'bring gnas skabs dang rdul nyid mchog min par bshad dang // mig la sogs dang phan tshun sgrub nus chub pa la //
analyzed: 'bring gnas skabs dang rdul nyid mchog min par bshad dang // mig la sogs dang phan tshun sgrub nus chub pa la //
translated: mediocrity is explained as non-supreme, and the eye, etc. are able to accomplish each other.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa chags med stobs su gsungs //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa chags med stobs su gsungs //
translated: The one who is omniscient, who is free from attachment, is declared to be powerful.

original: kun tu rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Imagination is the false superimposition of the unreal.

original: kun tu rtog pa ni dbang po nyid yin te /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa ni dbang po nyid yin te /
translated: Imagination is the sense faculty,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed pa la mnga' bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed pa la mnga' bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it is the master in the production of desire, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rgyu can rnams sdud par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rgyu can rnams sdud par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood to include the causes of the wholesome, such as faith, etc.

original: de'i phyir mchog gi sgras ni phul du byung ba brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog gi sgras ni phul du byung ba brjod de /
translated: Therefore, the word “supreme” expresses the highest.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring gi gnas skabs ni mchog ma yin pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring gi gnas skabs ni mchog ma yin pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The states of the lesser and the middling are expressed by the word “not supreme.”

original: mig sogs zhes bya ba 'dis ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po nyi shu @337b rtsa gnyis 'dzin to //
analyzed: mig sogs zhes bya ba 'dis ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po nyi shu @337b rtsa gnyis 'dzin to //
translated: “Eye, etc.” includes the twenty-two sense faculties such as the eye, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'dir dbang po'i rang gi ngo bo thugs su chud pa dang / phan tshun 'bras bu sgrub par nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo thugs su chud pa la mkhyen pa gang zhig thogs pa mi mnga' ba 'di ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag ste ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir dbang po'i rang gi ngo bo thugs su chud pa dang / phan tshun 'bras bu sgrub par nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo thugs su chud pa la mkhyen pa gang zhig thogs pa mi mnga' ba 'di ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag ste ;
translated: Therefore, the power to know supreme and nonsupreme faculties is posited as the unobstructed knowledge comprehending the nature of the faculties and comprehending the nature of the faculties that are mutually able to achieve results.

original: ji skad du /🔽rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po'i rim pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ji skad du / rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po'i rim pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: As the sutra states:🔽Son of noble family, moreover, the tathāgatas know the stages of the faculties of other sentient beings and other persons just as they are.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po'i rim pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes she na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po'i rim pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes she na /
translated: Son of noble family, how do the tathāgatas know the stages of the faculties of other sentient beings and other persons just as they are?

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can dbang po rtul po rnams kyang sems can dbang po rtul por yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can dbang po rtul po rnams kyang sems can dbang po rtul por yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: “Son of noble family, here the Tathāgata knows, in accordance with reality, the faculties of sentient beings who are of dull faculties as being dull faculties.

original: de bzhin du dbang po 'bring yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po 'bring yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the faculties of those who are of middling faculties as being middling faculties.

original: dbang po rnon po yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the faculties of those who are of sharp faculties as being sharp faculties.

original: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ci 'dra bas mthar song ba'i 'dod chags skye ba dang / mthar song ba'i zhe sdang dang / mthar song ba'i gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ci 'dra bas mthar song ba'i 'dod chags skye ba dang / mthar song ba'i zhe sdang dang / mthar song ba'i gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata also knows the faculties of those who have reached the limit of desire, hatred, and delusion, and who have reached the limit of their development.

original: mthar song ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mthar song ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu gyur pa'o //
translated: ‘Having reached the limit’ means having reached the ultimate.

original: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ci 'dra bas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug bcos ma skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ci 'dra bas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug bcos ma skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata also knows the faculties of those who have reached the limit of their artificial desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po gang gis snrel zhi'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye ba dang / yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po gang gis tshar bcad pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po gang gis snrel zhi'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye ba dang / yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po gang gis tshar bcad pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata knows the faculties of conceptualization through which desire, anger, and ignorance arise, and the faculties of conceptualization through which desire, anger, and ignorance are eliminated.

original: dbang po gang dag dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang po gang dag nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbang po gang dag dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang po gang dag nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata knows all the faculties that arise from the cause of virtue and the faculties that arise from the cause of liberation.🔽Moreover, the Tathāgata knows the eye faculty, and so on, up to the faculty of one who has knowledge.🔽The Tathāgata knows the cause from which the eye faculty arises, and the cause from which the ear faculty arises.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas mig gi dbang po rab tu shes pa nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'i bar rab tu shes so //🔽dbang po gang mig gi dbang po'i rgyu las byung ba rna ba'i dbang po 'jig @338a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas mig gi dbang po rab tu shes pa nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'i bar rab tu shes so // dbang po gang mig gi dbang po'i rgyu las byung ba rna ba'i dbang po 'jig @338a * //
translated: The Tathāgata knows the cause from which the nose faculty arises, and the cause from which the tongue faculty arises.🔽The Tathāgata knows the cause from which the body faculty arises, and the cause from which the mind faculty arises.

original: rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ni gzhan las rjes su mthun pa'i sgra dang so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /🔽de lta bu la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ni gzhan las rjes su mthun pa'i sgra dang so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste / de lta bu la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The cause of complete purification is the concordant sound of another and one's own proper mental attention.

original: de'i phyir rnam 'byor pa'i dbye bas so sor rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas par gyur pa bsam gtan la sogs pa de la mkhyen pa gang zhig thogs pa mi mnga' ba de ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam 'byor pa'i dbye bas so sor rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas par gyur pa bsam gtan la sogs pa de la mkhyen pa gang zhig thogs pa mi mnga' ba de ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: Thus, since there are infinite divisions of yoga, the knowledge of those such as meditative stabilization and so on is the power of knowledge of meditative stabilization, liberation, concentration,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: meditative attainment, complete affliction and complete purification and emergence.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ldang ba shes pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ldang ba shes pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family, the Tathāgata knows in accordance with reality all the meditative concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and absorptions of the tathāgatas, as well as their arising from affliction and purification.

original: ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know?

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //🔽sems can rnams kyi rnam par dag par @340a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so // sems can rnams kyi rnam par dag par @340a * //
translated: The Tathāgata knows the causes and conditions for the arising of affliction in sentient beings.

original: 'gyur ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //🔽de la rgyu ni gang /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so // de la rgyu ni gang /
translated: He also knows the causes and conditions for the purification of sentient beings.

original: rkyen ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the causes and what are the conditions?

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The cause of affliction for sentient beings is incorrect mental activity.

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The condition for the affliction of sentient beings is ignorance.

original: ma rig pa ni rgyu'o //🔽'du byed rnams ni rkyen to //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni rgyu'o // 'du byed rnams ni rkyen to //
translated: Ignorance is the cause.🔽Formations are the condition.

original: 'du byed ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni rgyu'o //
translated: Formations are the cause.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rkyen to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rkyen to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Consciousness is the condition.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni rgyu'o //
translated: Afflictions are the cause.

original: las rnams ni rkyen to //
analyzed: las rnams ni rkyen to //
translated: Actions are the condition.

original: lta ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: View is the cause.

original: sred pa ni rkyen to //
analyzed: sred pa ni rkyen to //
translated: Craving is the condition.

original: bag la nyal ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: Latent states are the cause.🔽Arising is the condition.

original: kun nas ldang ba ni rkyen te zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de la sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ni gang rkyen ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba ni rkyen te zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de la sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ni gang rkyen ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the causes and conditions for the purification of sentient beings?

original: rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis so //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis so //
translated: There are two causes and two conditions.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gzhan las rjes su mthun pa'i sgra dang / so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las rjes su mthun pa'i sgra dang / so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The first is hearing compatible speech from others and the second is proper attention.

original: gzhan yang gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two more.

original: zhi gnas la rtse gcig pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa'o zhes rgyas par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: zhi gnas la rtse gcig pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa'o zhes rgyas par 'byung zhing /
translated: The first is one pointed concentration and the second is skill in insight.

original: 'di ni sems can rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: This is the cause of the purification of beings.

original: 'di ni rkyen te de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni rkyen te de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: This is the condition. The Tathāgata knows it as it really is.

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes dang ldan pas 'dod pa rnams las dben pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes dang ldan pas 'dod pa rnams las dben pa /
translated: In the same way, son of noble family, the Tathāgata, endowed with knowledge, having become detached from desires,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /
translated: detached from evil and unwholesome dharmas,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied and sustained thought,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te 'gog pa las ldang ngo //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te 'gog pa las ldang ngo //
translated: enters and abides in the first concentration, which is born of detachment and filled with rapture and joy. He rises from cessation and enters the first concentration.

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs te bsam gtan dang po las ldang ngo //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs te bsam gtan dang po las ldang ngo //
translated: He rises from the first concentration and enters cessation.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la lugs dang mthun par yang snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la lugs dang mthun par yang snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: He enters the eight liberations in forward order.

original: lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / snrel zhir yang ngo //🔽ting nge 'dzin ni snyoms par 'jug par ston /
analyzed: lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / snrel zhir yang ngo //🔽ting nge 'dzin ni snyoms par 'jug par ston /
translated: He enters them in reverse order. He enters them skipping various stages.🔽He enters and rises from the various concentrations and spheres of mastery and spheres of totality in forward, reverse, and skipping orders.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni ting nge 'dzin du ston kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'dres pa gang yang med cing /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni ting nge 'dzin du ston kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'dres pa gang yang med cing /
translated: Although it is taught that the Tathāgata enters into samādhi, there is nothing in the Tathāgata’s samādhi that is mixed up.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya ba med do //
translated: The Tathāgata has no samādhi that he enters into by means of an object.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gcig gis ting nge 'dzin @340b thams cad mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gcig gis ting nge 'dzin @340b thams cad mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: The Tathāgata accomplishes all samādhis through a single samādhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gcig las ma langs par ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la sems gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gcig las ma langs par ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la sems gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa med /
translated: The Tathāgata enters into all samādhis without rising from a single samādhi, and the Tathāgata has no mind that moves from one to another.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The Tathāgata has no mind that is not in equipoise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni sus kyang blta bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni sus kyang blta bar mi nus te /
translated: No one can see the Tathāgata’s samādhi.

original: nyan thos kyi ting nge 'dzin ni rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi ting nge 'dzin ni rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis gnon to //
translated: The śrāvakas’ samādhi is surpassed by the pratyekabuddhas’ samādhi.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis gnon to ;
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis gnon to ;
translated: The concentration of the pratyekabuddhas is surpassed by the concentration of the bodhisattvas.

original: / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis gnon to //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is surpassed by the concentration of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni zil gyis mi gnon pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni zil gyis mi gnon pa ste /
translated: The concentration of the Tathagata is unsurpassed.

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni zil gyis mi gnon par 'jug pa'o //🔽gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa gang dang gang gis nyan thos rnams ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni zil gyis mi gnon par 'jug pa'o // gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa gang dang gang gis nyan thos rnams ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: Here, the knowledge of the Tathagata is unsurpassed.🔽The Tathagata knows the instructions and teachings through which the sravakas generate concentration.

original: gang gis rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang gis rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathagata also knows the instructions and teachings through which the pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas generate concentration.

original: shes nas kyang de bzhin du 'doms shing de bzhin du rjes su ston te /
analyzed: shes nas kyang de bzhin du 'doms shing de bzhin du rjes su ston te /
translated: Knowing this, he instructs accordingly and teaches accordingly.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bdun pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bdun pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the seventh Tathagata-action of the Tathagata.

original: da ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the power of knowledge of the recollection of former existences, it is said:

original: ji srid gti mug de srid srid gnas 'das bdag dang // sems can gzhan re re yi srid pa sems can ni //
analyzed: ji srid gti mug de srid srid gnas 'das bdag dang // sems can gzhan re re yi srid pa sems can ni //
translated: For as long as there is delusion, there is the self of the past, present, and future, and the existences of each and every other sentient being.

original: ji snyed de snyed mtha' yas gzhir bcas yul phyogs dang // bcas rnams la blo gang dang gang yin stobs su bshad //
analyzed: ji snyed de snyed mtha' yas gzhir bcas yul phyogs dang // bcas rnams la blo gang dang gang yin stobs su bshad //
translated: The mind that knows the limitless sentient beings, along with their bases, objects, and locations, is explained as a power.

original: ji srid gti mug ces bya ba 'dis ni skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thog ma med pa sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i yul nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: ji srid gti mug ces bya ba 'dis ni skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thog ma med pa sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i yul nyid du bshad do //
translated: By for as long as there is delusion, the object of the knowledge of the recollection of former existences, which is the beginningless succession of births, is explained.

original: sems can ji snyed ces bya ba 'dis ni sems can gyi khams mu mtha' med pa bsdu bar brjod do //
analyzed: sems can ji snyed ces bya ba 'dis ni sems can gyi khams mu mtha' med pa bsdu bar brjod do //
translated: By as many sentient beings as there are, the limitless realm of sentient beings is included.

original: gzhir bcas smos pas ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid kyi sgo nas de bsdu ba @341a * //🔽bshad do // ga ge mo zhig nas bdag kha dog ni 'di 'dra bar gyur /
analyzed: gzhir bcas smos pas ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid kyi sgo nas de bsdu ba @341a * // bshad do // ga ge mo zhig nas bdag kha dog ni 'di 'dra bar gyur /
translated: The expression “together with the basis” indicates that the recollection includes the cause.

original: rnam pa ni 'di lta bur gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'di lta bur gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “I was in such and such a place, of such and such a type, with such and such experiences, etc.,” as in the sutra.

original: de la kha dog ni 'di 'dra bar gyur zhes bya bar rjes su dran pas ni rnam pa dang bcas par rjes su dran par 'gyur ro //🔽che ge mo zhig na bdag gnas nas de nas shi 'phos nas ga ge mo zhig tu skyes /
analyzed: de la kha dog ni 'di 'dra bar gyur zhes bya bar rjes su dran pas ni rnam pa dang bcas par rjes su dran par 'gyur ro // che ge mo zhig na bdag gnas nas de nas shi 'phos nas ga ge mo zhig tu skyes /
translated: Therein, by the recollection “I was of such and such a color,” one recollects the type.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes bya bar dran pas ni yul phyogs dang bcas par rjes su dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes bya bar dran pas ni yul phyogs dang bcas par rjes su dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the recollection “I was in such and such a place, and having died from there, I was born here,” one recollects the place.

original: lhag ma ni rgyu dang bcas par rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rgyu dang bcas par rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The rest is the recollection of the cause.

original: de ltar sngon gyi srid pa gzhi dang bcas pa dang / yul phyogs dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa gang zhig thogs pa mi mnga' ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sngon gyi srid pa gzhi dang bcas pa dang / yul phyogs dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa gang zhig thogs pa mi mnga' ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs yin no //
translated: Thus, the power of the Buddha Bhagavans knowledge of former existences is unobstructed knowledge of former existences, together with their bases, together with their directions, and together with their aspects.

original: stobs 'dis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba 'das pa dag ma lus par ji lta ba bzhin thugs su chud de /
analyzed: stobs 'dis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba 'das pa dag ma lus par ji lta ba bzhin thugs su chud de /
translated: By this power, the Buddha Bhagavans comprehend without exception, just as they are, the past movements of mind and mental factors.

original: skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i tshul mkhyen pa nyid kyis chos 'bras bu yod pa ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i tshul mkhyen pa nyid kyis chos 'bras bu yod pa ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: By knowing what is and is not possible, they teach the Dharma that is not empty of results.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de sems can de'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no //
analyzed: de sems can de'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no //
translated: He recollects the former existences of that sentient being.

original: sngon gyi rgyu ji lta bu dang / rgyu gang gis sems can gang kun tu byung ba de'i sngon gyi rgyu de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes te shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu ji lta bu dang / rgyu gang gis sems can gang kun tu byung ba de'i sngon gyi rgyu de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes te shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows the former causes and the causes by which any sentient being has come into existence. Having known them, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu ba 'das pa yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu ba 'das pa yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata also knows the mental processes of all sentient beings.

original: sems gang gis dmigs pa can gyi 'og tu sems gang gis dmigs pa can skye ba dang / dmigs pa gang gis skye ba dang / dmigs pa gang dang bral ba na 'gag pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems gang gis dmigs pa can gyi 'og tu sems gang gis dmigs pa can skye ba dang / dmigs pa gang gis skye ba dang / dmigs pa gang dang bral ba na 'gag pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the object of the mind by which one who has an object of the mind is born, and the object by which one who is separated from an object ceases.

original: de ltar ji tsam du sems can gcig gi sems gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'jug pa de lta bu zhig gi 'og tu sems 'di lta bu zhig byung la /
analyzed: de ltar ji tsam du sems can gcig gi sems gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'jug pa de lta bu zhig gi 'og tu sems 'di lta bu zhig byung la /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of a single sentient being, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of two sentient beings, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of three sentient beings, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of four sentient beings, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of five sentient beings, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of six sentient beings, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of seven sentient beings, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of eight sentient beings, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of nine sentient beings, and after that, the Tathāgata knows the mental continuum of ten sentient beings.

original: de'i 'og tu yang 'di lta bu zhig byung ba de bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du yang tshig tu bstan pas bstan par dka'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang 'di lta bu zhig byung ba de bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du yang tshig tu bstan pas bstan par dka'o //
translated: After that, it is difficult to teach this by means of words even for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: de bzhin du sems @341b can thams cad kyi yang de lta bu so sor sems gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems @341b can thams cad kyi yang de lta bu so sor sems gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata knows the individual mind streams of all sentient beings.

original: yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung ste phyi ma'i mur thug par bstan kyang de'i ye shes mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung ste phyi ma'i mur thug par bstan kyang de'i ye shes mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one were to teach this for as long as the world exists, the limit of his wisdom would not be reached.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab cing mtshungs pa med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab cing mtshungs pa med la /
translated: The Tathāgata’s knowledge of the recollection of former existences is inconceivable and incomparable.

original: tshad med de /
analyzed: tshad med de /
translated: It is immeasurable.

original: de'i mtha' ni bstan par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni bstan par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not easy to teach its limit.

original: sangs rgyas khyu mchog tu gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas khyu mchog tu gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag la /
translated: The Tathāgata, the supreme leader among the buddhas, teaches sentient beings:

original: kye sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba sangs rgyas la bskrun pa'am /
analyzed: kye sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba sangs rgyas la bskrun pa'am /
translated: ‘Oh sentient beings, those who plant the roots of virtue in the Buddha,

original: nyan thos la bskrun pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos la bskrun pa'am /
translated: or to the śrāvakas,🔽or to the pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas la bskrun ba de lta bu dran par gyis shig ces dran par byed do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la bskrun ba de lta bu dran par gyis shig ces dran par byed do //
translated: Thus, they are made to remember.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: And it is like this:

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus sems can de dag gis kyang dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus sems can de dag gis kyang dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: through the power of the Buddha, those sentient beings also remember.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs pa de dang des ci nas theg pas rnam par grol ba las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs pa de dang des ci nas theg pas rnam par grol ba las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar chos ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata teaches the Dharma to them in such and such a way, by means of such and such a root of virtue, so that they will not turn back from liberation by the vehicle.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las brgyad pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las brgyad pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the eighth Tathāgata activity of the Tathāgata.”

original: da ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, it is said:🔽The deaths and rebirths of each sentient being,🔽whatever abides in the world, reaching the end of space,

original: sems can rnams kyi sems can re re'i 'chi 'pho dang // skye gang 'jig rten la gnas nam mkha'i mthar thug dang // bkra mang de la mkhyen pa dus der 'jug pa yis //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems can re re'i 'chi 'pho dang // skye gang 'jig rten la gnas nam mkha'i mthar thug dang // bkra mang de la mkhyen pa dus der 'jug pa yis //
translated: with knowledge of the many good things, engaging at that time,

original: ma chags rnam kun yongs dag mtha' yas stobs su 'dod //
analyzed: ma chags rnam kun yongs dag mtha' yas stobs su 'dod //
translated: The power of knowing the absorptions, deliverances, meditative concentrations, and meditative attainments is asserted to be unattached, completely pure in every way, and limitless.

original: 'chi 'pho ba ni phung po 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba ni phung po 'jig pa'o //
translated: Death is the disintegration of the aggregates.

original: skye ba ni phung po'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni phung po'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: Birth is the continuation of the aggregates.

original: 'jig rten ma lus pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
translated: The deaths and rebirths of all worldly beings, which extend to the end of space,

original: las shin tu sna tshogs pa'i bzos sbyar ba gang dag yin pa de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis skad cig gcig kho na la lhun gyis grub par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen la /
analyzed: las shin tu sna tshogs pa'i bzos sbyar ba gang dag yin pa de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis skad cig gcig kho na la lhun gyis grub par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen la /
translated: are the products of the various actions of beings. The Blessed One knows all of these in a single moment, spontaneously and in accordance with reality.

original: de'i ye shes yul 'ga' la yang chags pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de'i ye shes yul 'ga' la yang chags pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: His wisdom is not attached to any object.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pas thogs pa mi mnga' ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pas thogs pa mi mnga' ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because it is completely pure in every way, it is unobstructed. This is the Blessed One’s power of knowing deaths and rebirths.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams kyi @342a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams kyi @342a * //
translated: The Blessed One knows the aspirations of sentient beings.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does he know death and rebirth,

original: 'on kyang lha'i spyan gyis 'chags pa dang 'jig pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa mang po thams cad kyang ma tshang ba med par rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha'i spyan gyis 'chags pa dang 'jig pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa mang po thams cad kyang ma tshang ba med par rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: but he also knows with his divine eye the various and numerous things such as the formation and destruction of the world systems.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As the sutra states:

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig ni 'di yin te /🔽mig des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig ni 'di yin te / mig des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
translated: The divine eye of the Tathagata is as follows:

original: tshad med grangs med pa bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na zhing du snang ba gang la la sems can gyi rjes su bzung ba 'jig pa dang 'chags pa de dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshad med grangs med pa bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na zhing du snang ba gang la la sems can gyi rjes su bzung ba 'jig pa dang 'chags pa de dag mthong ngo //
translated: With that eye he sees the formation and destruction of all the buddhafields, which are beyond number and measure, beyond all reckoning, in the worlds of the ten directions, throughout the realm of phenomena, to the ends of space.

original: gang la la sems can du snang ba 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang la la sems can du snang ba 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all those who appear as sentient beings, who die, are reborn, go to good or bad destinies, and go according to their karma.

original: gang la la byang chub sems dpar snang ba 'chi 'pho ba dang mngal du 'jug pa dang 'byung ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang la la byang chub sems dpar snang ba 'chi 'pho ba dang mngal du 'jug pa dang 'byung ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all those who appear as bodhisattvas, who die, enter the womb, and are born.

original: gang la la sangs rgyas su snang ba mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba tshe'i 'du byed 'dor ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang la la sangs rgyas su snang ba mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba tshe'i 'du byed 'dor ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all those who appear as buddhas, who fully awaken, turn the wheel of Dharma, give up the compositional factors of life, and pass into parinirvāṇa.

original: gang la la nyan thos su snang ba rnam par grol ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang la la nyan thos su snang ba rnam par grol ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all those who appear as śrāvakas, who are liberated and pass into parinirvāṇa.

original: gang la la rang sangs rgyas su snang ba rdzu 'phrul ston pa yon sbyong ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang la la rang sangs rgyas su snang ba rdzu 'phrul ston pa yon sbyong ba de dag thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all those who appear as pratyekabuddhas, who display miracles and purify their gifts.

original: sems can gang dag snang bar gyur pa dag dang gang dag phyi rol gyi mngon par shes pa lnga po rnams kyi mig lam du byung ba dang / nyan thos rnams kyi ma yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gang dag snang bar gyur pa dag dang gang dag phyi rol gyi mngon par shes pa lnga po rnams kyi mig lam du byung ba dang / nyan thos rnams kyi ma yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ma yin pa dang /
translated: Those sentient beings who are visible to the eye of the Tathāgata, who are in the range of vision of those who have the five kinds of external knowledge, who are not in the range of vision of the śrāvakas, who are not in the range of vision of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag gi ma yin pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag gi ma yin pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and who are not in the range of vision of the bodhisattvas—those sentient beings are visible to the divine eye of the Tathāgata.🔽Moreover, those sentient beings who are not visible in a region the size of a chariot wheel, but who are visible to the Tathāgata, are much more numerous than those gods and humans in the great billionfold world system who are

original: yang shing rta'i 'phang lo tsam gyi phyogs na snang bar ma gyur ba'i sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la snang bar gyur pa de dag ni ches mang gi / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha dang mi rnams ni de🔽lta ma yin no //
analyzed: yang shing rta'i 'phang lo tsam gyi phyogs na snang bar ma gyur ba'i sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la snang bar gyur pa de dag ni ches mang gi / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha dang mi rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: visible in a region the size of a chariot wheel.

original: de bzhin du snang bar ma gyur pa'i sems can gyi khams tshad med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du snang bar ma gyur pa'i sems can gyi khams tshad med do //
translated: In the same way, the realm of sentient beings who are not visible is immeasurable.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyis 'dul @342b ba'i sems can gang yin zhes de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sems can gyi khams la rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyis 'dul @342b ba'i sems can gang yin zhes de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sems can gyi khams la rnam par blta'o //
translated: Thus, the Buddha looks with his divine eye of the tathāgatas at the realm of sentient beings in all buddhafields, thinking, “What sentient beings are to be trained by the Buddha?”

original: sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gyi ris ji snyed pa de dag gi mdun du de snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs shing sems can de dag 'dul yang de ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan gyis mi shes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gyi ris ji snyed pa de dag gi mdun du de snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs shing sems can de dag 'dul yang de ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan gyis mi shes te /
translated: As many classes of sentient beings as there are to be trained by the Buddha, that many tathāgatas appear before them and train those sentient beings. But other sentient beings do not know this.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i las dgu pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i las dgu pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the ninth tathāgata activity.

original: da ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the power of knowing the exhaustion of contaminants, it is said:

original: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis myur du rgyal rnams kyi //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis myur du rgyal rnams kyi //
translated: By the power of omniscience, the afflictions of the victors🔽together with their imprints are quickly destroyed,

original: nyon mongs dang ni bag chags dang bcas 'jig 'gyur dang // slob ma la sogs nyon mongs blo yis 'gog pa yang //
analyzed: nyon mongs dang ni bag chags dang bcas 'jig 'gyur dang // slob ma la sogs nyon mongs blo yis 'gog pa yang //
translated: and the cessation of the afflictions of disciples and so on is also known.

original: de la mkhyen pa chags med mtha' yas stobs su 'dod //
analyzed: de la mkhyen pa chags med mtha' yas stobs su 'dod //
translated: The power of the knowledge of the liberations and the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities is asserted to be the power of the knowledge of the liberations and the power of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: de la nyon mongs pa dag ni ma rig pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa dag ni ma rig pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: The afflictions are ignorance, attachment, and so on.

original: 'jig rten khams gsum pa nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams gsum pa nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called afflictions because they afflict the three worlds.🔽The latent states of the afflictions are the latent states of the afflictions that are not manifest.🔽They are called latent states because they conceal and obscure the mindstream and follow it.

original: gang gis sems kyi rgyud 'bag par byed cing sgo bar byed la rjes su bgrod par byed pa de ni bag chags te nyon mongs pa'i mur thug pa dang goms pa dang rtsa ba dang bag chags zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: gang gis sems kyi rgyud 'bag par byed cing sgo bar byed la rjes su bgrod par byed pa de ni bag chags te nyon mongs pa'i mur thug pa dang goms pa dang rtsa ba dang bag chags zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go //
translated: They are called the end of the afflictions, the habit of the afflictions, the root of the afflictions, and latent states.

original: de ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs su zin kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis spang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs su zin kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis spang bar mi nus te /
translated: Even though the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have abandoned the afflictions by means of the uncontaminated path, they are unable to abandon the latent states of the afflictions.

original: til mar dang me tog la sogs pa bsal du zin kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams la de dag dang phrad pas yon tan phra mo dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: til mar dang me tog la sogs pa bsal du zin kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams la de dag dang phrad pas yon tan phra mo dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is because even though the oil and the flowers, etc., have been removed, the qualities of the pot and the cloth, etc., are observed to be subtle.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa spangs kyang bag chags yod pas dgra bcom pa sngon du spre'ur gyur pa mchong zhing mchong zhing 'gro ba dang sngon bram zer gyur pa'i dmangs mor brjod pa'i kun tu spyod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlog tu zin kyang ma log pa dmigs🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa spangs kyang bag chags yod pas dgra bcom pa sngon du spre'ur gyur pa mchong zhing mchong zhing 'gro ba dang sngon bram zer gyur pa'i dmangs mor brjod pa'i kun tu spyod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlog tu zin kyang ma log pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although afflictions are abandoned, since their imprints remain, arhats who were previously monkeys jump and run, and the conduct of a former brahmin who was called “shudra” by a shudra woman was not stopped by the Bhagavat.

original: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags ni shes bya yongs su dpyod pa'i gegs su gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags ni shes bya yongs su dpyod pa'i gegs su gyur pa yin la /
translated: The imprint of ignorance is the obstruction to thorough analysis of objects of knowledge.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags yod pa ni lus dang ngag gi 'jug pa rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu yang yin te /🔽ma rig pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang sangs rgyas kho na la ldog @343a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags yod pa ni lus dang ngag gi 'jug pa rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu yang yin te / ma rig pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang sangs rgyas kho na la ldog @343a * //
translated: The existence of the imprints of attachment and so on is the cause of such physical and verbal engagement.

original: par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: The imprints of ignorance and attachment and so on are eliminated only for omniscient buddhas and not for others.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bag chags lhag ma lus par spangs pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi mkhyen pa gang zhig thams cad du thogs pa mi mnga' ba de ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bag chags lhag ma lus par spangs pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi mkhyen pa gang zhig thams cad du thogs pa mi mnga' ba de ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, the buddhas' knowledge that completely abandons the remaining latent states of affliction and that abandons the afflictions that are the connection of latent states is posited as the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa thams cad zad pas bdag gi skye ba ni zad /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa thams cad zad pas bdag gi skye ba ni zad /
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, since the tathāgatas have exhausted all contaminants, they know, “My births are exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten /
translated: I have relied on pure conduct.

original: bya ba ni byas te 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes te /
analyzed: bya ba ni byas te 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes te /
translated: I have done what needs to be done. From this life onward I will not know another existence.”

original: zag pa med pa sems rnam par grol ba shes rab rnam par grol ba rang gi mngon par shes pa mngon sum du byas nas de nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa sems rnam par grol ba shes rab rnam par grol ba rang gi mngon par shes pa mngon sum du byas nas de nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: They abide having actualized the uncontaminated liberation of mind and liberation of wisdom, having accomplished their own goal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa shes pa de ni rnam par dag pa dri ma med pa yongs su dag pa 'od gsal ba bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang yang dag par bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa shes pa de ni rnam par dag pa dri ma med pa yongs su dag pa 'od gsal ba bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang yang dag par bcom pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata's knowledge of the destruction of the impurities is pure, stainless, cleansed, radiant, and has completely destroyed all the latent tendencies.

original: nyon thos rnams kyi zag pa zad pa ni tshad yod pa bag chags yang dag par ma bcom pa'o //
analyzed: nyon thos rnams kyi zag pa zad pa ni tshad yod pa bag chags yang dag par ma bcom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the impurities of the Sravakas is limited and has not completely destroyed the latent tendencies.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi zag pa zad pa ni tshad yod pa snying rje chen po dang bral ba spobs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi zag pa zad pa ni tshad yod pa snying rje chen po dang bral ba spobs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The destruction of the impurities of the Pratyekabuddhas is limited and is devoid of great compassion and eloquence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa ni rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par bcom pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa ni rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par bcom pa /
translated: The Tathagata's destruction of the impurities is endowed with all the most excellent aspects and has completely destroyed all the latent tendencies.

original: thugs rje chen pos kun tu bzung ba mi 'jigs pa dang spobs pa dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos kun tu bzung ba mi 'jigs pa dang spobs pa dang ma bral ba /
translated: It is sustained by great compassion and is not devoid of fearlessness and eloquence.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa ste sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa ste sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is not overwhelmed by the entire world and is endowed with a single moment of thought.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la las kyi bag chags med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la las kyi bag chags med /
translated: The Tathāgata has no habitual propensities of karma,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags med /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags med /
translated: no habitual propensities of afflictions,

original: spyod lam 'khrul pa'i bag chags med do //
analyzed: spyod lam 'khrul pa'i bag chags med do //
translated: and no habitual propensities of confused behavior.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pas rdul dang du ba dang lhan cig mi gnas pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pas rdul dang du ba dang lhan cig mi gnas pa de bzhin du //
translated: Just as space is pure by nature and does not coexist with dust and smoke,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa shes pa yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa shes pa yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyis lhag par mos par bya bar dka' ba'i phyir na bsnyad par bya ba ma yin te /

analyzed: de ltar re zhig mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus brjod nas /

translated: and they will not enter into the peace of nirvana.🔽The Blessed Lord, born of the perfection of wisdom, his mother, and entrusted to the care of the nurse, compassion,🔽his life span will be infinite.

translated: For as long as the whole world has not become all Buddha,🔽and as long as space does not perish, for so long will the Buddhas, born of the perfection of wisdom, their mother, and entrusted to the care of the nurse, compassion,

analyzed: bshad pa / gti mug skyon gyis 'jig rten kha zas dug bcas za ba yi //
translated: Response: The world, due to the fault of delusion, eats food mixed with poison.

analyzed: skye bo nyid kyi nang mi de la khyod brtse ji lta ba //

analyzed: de ltar dug zos nyen pa'i bu la ma yis sdug bsngal min //

analyzed: 'jig rten kha zas kyi sgras ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga brjod do //

analyzed: sdug bsngal rgya chen po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de dag la 'di nyid du bden par mngon par zhen pa yang gti mug gi skyon las skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la ji ltar bcom ldan 'das la skye bo 'khor ba pa 'jig rten gyi kha zas dug dang bcas pa za ba la brtse ba 'khrungs pa de ltar ma la bu gcig pa phangs pa de las gzhan pa'i dug dang 'dres pa'i kha zas za ba la
translated: Just as the Bhagavān has compassion for beings in cyclic existence who consume food that is like food mixed with poison, so too he has compassion for those who consume food mixed with the poison of attachment to their dear only child.

original: gdung ba skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gdung ba skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Just as the Bhagavān has compassion for the people of cyclic existence who consume worldly food that is mixed with poison, the Bhagavān’s compassion for sentient beings who are tormented by the poison of the afflictions is not like the love a mother has for her only child, which is not like the love she has for her other children who consume food mixed with poison.

translated: the Bhagavān does not have nirvana because he sees the world, which is the basis for experiencing the various sufferings of the world.

translated: Here, because of the existence of the belief in the effect of action, the ignorant, whose minds are attached to things, have the view that there is birth among gods and humans.
